App

class app.core.system.ArtifactRegistry(database: Database, storage: Storage)[source]

Bases: object

A registry for managing artifacts, including saving, listing,

retrieving, and deleting artifacts.

__init__(database: Database, storage: Storage) → None[source]

Initialize the ArtifactRegistry with a database and storage.

Parameters:

  • database – The database to store artifact metadata.

  • storage – The storage to save artifact data.

delete(artifact_id: str) → None[source]

Delete an artifact by its ID.

Parameters:

artifact_id – The ID of the artifact to delete.

get(artifact_id: str) → Artifact[source]

Retrieve an artifact by its ID.

Parameters:

artifact_id – The ID of the artifact to retrieve.

Returns:

The retrieved artifact.

list(type: str = None) → List[Artifact][source]

List all artifacts, optionally filtered by type.

Parameters:

type – The type of artifacts to list.

Returns:

A list of artifacts.

register(artifact: Artifact) → None[source]
Register an artifact by saving its data in

storage and its metadata in the db.

Parameters:

artifact – The artifact to register.

class autoop.core.database.Database(storage: Storage)[source]

Bases: object

A simple database class that uses a storage backend to persist data.

__init__(storage: Storage) → None[source]

Initialize the database with a storage backend.

Parameters:

storage (Storage) – The storage backend to use.

_load() → None[source]

Load the data from storage.

_persist() → None[source]

Persist the data to storage.

delete(collection: str, id: str) → None[source]

Delete a key from the database.

Parameters:

  • collection (str) – The collection to delete the data from.

  • id (str) – The id of the data.

get(collection: str, id: str) → dict | None[source]

Get a key from the database.

Parameters:

  • collection (str) – The collection to get the data from.

  • id (str) – The id of the data.

Returns:

The data that was stored,

or None if it doesn’t exist.

Return type:

Union[dict, None]

list(collection: str) → List[Tuple[str, dict]][source]

Lists all data in a collection.

Parameters:

collection (str) – The collection to list the data from.

Returns:

A list of tuples

containing the id and data

for each item in the collection.

Return type:

List[Tuple[str, dict]]

refresh() → None[source]

Refresh the database by loading the data from storage.

set(collection: str, id: str, entry: dict) → dict[source]

Set a key in the database.

Parameters:

  • collection (str) – The collection to store the data in.

  • id (str) – The id of the data.

  • entry (dict) – The data to store.

Returns:

The data that was stored.

Return type:

dict

class autoop.core.storage.LocalStorage(base_path: str = './assets')[source]

Local storage implementation of the Storage abstract base class.

AutoOP Functional

autoop.functional.feature.detect_feature_types(dataset: Dataset) → List[Feature][source]

Detects feature types in the dataset.

Assumption: only categorical and numeric features and no NaN values.

Parameters:

dataset (Dataset) – The dataset to analyze.

Returns:

List of features with their types.

Return type:

List[Feature]

Raises:

ValueError – If dataset is not an instance of Dataset or if dataset has no data to read.

autoop.functional.preprocessing.preprocess_features(features: List[Feature], dataset: Dataset) → List[Tuple[str, ndarray, dict]][source]

Preprocess features.

Parameters:

  • features (List[Feature]) – List of features.

  • dataset (Dataset) – Dataset object.

Returns:

List of preprocessed features. Each ndarray of shape (N, …)

Return type:

List[Tuple[str, np.ndarray, dict]]
